learning_outcomes.description: Critically evaluate existing literature in a chosen field interpreting research findings accurately, drawing appropriate conclusions, identifying gaps, inconsistencies and limitations to provide a nuanced understanding of the current state of knowledge.

Critically evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of different arguments and theories, analyse the methodological approaches used in studies, and assess the implications of the literature to inform current practice and recommend future research.

Using an integrated understanding of research, design and develop an integrative review which synthesises information from diverse sources to construct a comprehensive and cohesive narrative that reflects the current knowledge, debates, theories, and frameworks in the research area.

Demonstrate advanced communication skills to articulate complex ideas clearly, structure arguments logically, and use appropriate academic conventions and referencing styles to effectively present research findings.

assessments.task_description:
HLTH4316 Assessment 1 requires you to conduct a search on a pre-set research question. You are required to demonstrate comprehension and proficiency in conducting an academic search which includes the ability to choose an appropriate search strategy (library/web searches versus database searches or a combination of both). You are also required to reflect on your search process and outcomes.

Full details for this assessment can be found on the course BlackBoard Ultra site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission will be through the course Blackboard site using the Turnitin link.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The second HLTH4316 assessment requires you to demonstrate an understanding of quality appraisal tools and their use in appraising literature. It then requires you to present a ‘mind map’ of how you have structured an argument to address your research question and provide an accompanying overview of the literature you have chosen to address your research question.

The full details of this assessment can be found on the course BlackBoard Ultra site.
